intro: Latrienda palmata, commonly known as the Florida fan palm, is a species of palm native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its fan-shaped leaves that are typically light green in color and arranged in a dense, bushy crown. The plant has a slender, unbranched trunk that is covered with a fibrous, spongy material. Latrienda palmata thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes and swamps. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem and a popular ornamental plant.
